errors.error_description: The installation command `pip install hazm torch` incorrectly bundles the 'torch' library as a mandatory dependency, while it is only required for optional features like word embeddings.
correction_candidates: Change the command to `pip install hazm`.
Change the command to `pip install hazm[full]`.
Change the command to `pip install hazm` and add a note that `torch` is needed for some modules.
Change the command to `pip install hazm[torch]`.
errors.golden_answer: Change the command to `pip install hazm`.

Change `lemmatizer.lemmatize = 'می‌روم'` to `lemmatizer('می‌روم')`.
Change `lemmatizer.lemmatize = 'می‌روم'` to `lemmatizer.lemmatize(text='می‌روم')`.
Change `lemmatizer.lemmatize = 'می‌روم'` to `Lemmatizer.lemmatize('می‌روم')`.

errors.error_description: The usage example for `POSTagger` specifies an incorrect model filename (`postagger.model` instead of `pos_tagger.model`), which will lead to a `FileNotFoundError` if the user follows the official model download links.
correction_candidates: Change `model='postagger.model'` to `model='pos_tagger.model'`.
Change `model='postagger.model'` to `model_path='pos_tagger.model'`.
Change `model='postagger.model'` to point to the full path, e.g., `model='./models/pos_tagger.model'`.
Remove the `model` argument to use the default model: `tagger = POSTagger()`.

errors.error_description: The command to install the package from GitHub is syntactically incorrect. `pip install --git` is not a valid pip command.
correction_candidates: Change `pip install --git https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git` to `pip install git+https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git`.
Change `pip install --git https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git` to `git clone https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git` followed by `pip install .`.
Change `pip install --git https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git` to `pip install -e git+https://github.com/roshan-research/hazm.git#egg=hazm`.
Change `pip install --git` to `pip install --repo`.

errors.error_description: The usage example for `SpacyPOSTagger` provides a specific but non-existent relative file path (`./models/spacy_pos_tagger`) instead of a generic placeholder, which will cause a file not found error as this directory structure is not created by default.
correction_candidates: Change `model_path = './models/spacy_pos_tagger'` back to the placeholder `model_path = 'MODELPATH'`.
Change `model_path = './models/spacy_pos_tagger'` to `model_path = 'roshan-research/spacy_pos_tagger_parsbertpostagger'` to load directly from Hugging Face.
Add a note before the code block: 'First, download the model and place it in a `./models/` directory.'
Change the path to an absolute path placeholder like `model_path = '/path/to/your/model'`.
